revised_title: Researches in Animal Electricity: Electrical Phenomena in Nerve and Muscle
tldr: The author investigates the electrical phenomena in living nerve and muscle during rest and in action, as well as the effects of voltaic and other electricities on nerve and muscle. The study suggests that nerve and muscle fibers can act as charged Leyden jars and that a discharge similar to that of the Torpedo may occur during nervous and muscular action.
